item.title: Communities with low incomes, immigrants, essential workers hardest hit by COVID-19: study
item.description: A Canadian research team found that COVID-19 cases were 'disproportionately concentrated' in communities with lower incomes and a higher proportion of visible minorities, recent immigrants, high-density housing and essential workers.

item.title: Astronomers Scan the Center of the Milky Way for Any Sign of Intelligent Civilizations. Nothing but Silence.

item.title: We Need A Standard Unit Of Measure For Risk
item.description: A few decades ago the Stanford professor Ronald Howard proposed a unit of measure for mortality risk. He called it the “micromort.” One micromort equaled a one-in-one-million chance of dying.

item.title: How to make a difficult decision
item.description: It’s not just the high stakes that can make decisions difficult: sometimes the reasons lie in your past. Avoiding a decision is in fact a decision.
item.content:encoded: It’s not just the high stakes that can make decisions difficult: sometimes the reasons lie in your past. Avoiding a decision is in fact a decision.
item.itunes:author: Matter
item.itunes:summary: It’s not just the high stakes that can make decisions difficult: sometimes the reasons lie in your past. Avoiding a decision is in fact a decision.
